column5: On holiday's this week to get the rest of the school's set-up, travelling today tomorrow & Wednesday for sure maybe Thursday to finish them off. Then off to a Waterloo Wellington Bass Anglers meeting in Hespler to hear Matt Pezzetta talk about Raymarine Marine Electronics & his Qualifier Experience great talk & I won a Shimano Symetre, icing on the cake. Tight Lines SBK  http://lhfcschoolhatcheries.blogspot.ca/2015/11/3-more-schools-set-up-today-st-anthonys.html
Richard, keep the updates coming. As I said before,I truely enjoy  the kids learning. I know my miss Lilly would love this stuff. I,ll be showing her your updated videos.
Very cool.     Great works as always.    Is there any upcoming opportunity  for volunteers?   Finclipping ect.   Hech I'd come mop the floors to help out if you want.

There is a spot on Friday's crew for the Kincardine Hatchery, Al Wilkins would love to get some help & I'm looking for people that might be interested in helping with School Salmon Hatchery Program too, our area is growing every year. Volunteers can always contact the club through the web site & Rick will direct you in the right direction or get the right person to contact you. Thanx & Tight Lines SBK
